TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ModelMetadata extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a container for metadata for a model.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The word *model* is used differently in the context of this class than it is typically used elsewhere. In an ASP.NET Web Forms application, the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelBindingContext.ModelType%2A> attribute of a data-bound control specifies the type of a data element that the data control is bound to. This type is typically referred to as the model, and it typically corresponds to a row in a database table. The properties of the model typically correspond to columns of the table.
A ModelMetadata object can provide metadata for the model itself or for a property of the model, or for a property of a complex property. When the ModelMetadata object pertains to a property, the word *model* refers to the property, and the word *container* refers to the model.
For example, the model might be **Contact**, which has **Name** and **Age** properties, and the **Name** property might be a complex property composed of **FirstName** and **LastName**. When the ModelMetadata object pertains to the **Contact** object, the model type is **Contact** and there is no container. When the ModelMetadata object pertains to the **Name** property, the model type is **Name** and the container type is **Contact**. When the ModelMetadata object pertains to the **FirstName** property, the model type is **FirstName** and the container type is **Name**.

MemberSignature.Value: public ModelMetadata (System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadataProvider provider, Type containerType, Func<object> modelAccessor, Type modelType, string propertyName);

Gets a collection that contains additional metadata about the model.

Docs.value: The type of the container, or if there is no container.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ConvertEmptyStringToNull { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether empty strings that are submitted in forms should be converted to .
Docs.value: if empty strings should be converted to ; otherwise, . The default value is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string DataTypeName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the data type.
Docs.value: The name of the data type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can be used to provide additional information about the type of data that is stored by the model. For example, if the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.ModelType%2A> property is set to <xref:System.String>, this property might be "EmailAddress" or "Url" â€” that is, a name that indicates more than just that the data is typed as a string.

Docs.summary: An integer value that is always set to `10000`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string Description { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets text that describes the model.
Docs.value: The description text.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string DisplayFormatString { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a format string that should be applied when the model is displayed in display mode (as opposed to in edit mode).
Docs.value: The format string.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string DisplayName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text to use in UI when the name of the model is displayed.
Docs.value: The text to use as the name of the model.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string EditFormatString { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the format string to use in UI in edit mode.
Docs.value: The format string.

Docs.summary: Returns text to display as the name of the model in UI.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether surrounding HTML should be hidden.
Docs.value: if surrounding HTML should be hidden; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the model is a complex type.
Docs.value: if the model is a complex type; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Built-in .NET Framework types are not considered complex types for purposes of this property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the model is a nullable value type.
Docs.value: if the model is a nullable value type; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the model can be updated.
Docs.value: if the model is read-only; otherwise, The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsRequired { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the property is required.
Docs.value: if the property is required; otherwise, . The default is for non-nullable value types and for all other types.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the model object.
Docs.value: The model object.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the model.
Docs.value: The type of the model.

Docs.summary: Gets the string that should be displayed when the model is .
Docs.value: The string to display when the model is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an integer that indicates the order in which to display this property relative to other properties.
Docs.value: The relative order in which to display this property.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of model metadata objects that describe the properties of the model.
Docs.value: Metadata for all properties in the model.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the property.
Docs.value: The name of the property if the model is a property; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the provider object for this metadata.
Docs.value: The provider object for this metadata.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool RequestValidationEnabled { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether request validation is enabled.
Docs.value: if request validation is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ShortDisplayName { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a short version of the display name.
Docs.value: The text to display when a short version of the model name is required.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The short display name can be used in a tooltip or in any UI where the complete display name might not fit. If this field is `null`, the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.DisplayName%2A> property should be used.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ShowForDisplay { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the model should be displayed in the UI in display mode (as opposed to edit mode).
Docs.value: if the model should be displayed in display mode; otherwise, . The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool ShowForEdit { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the property should be displayed in edit mode (as opposed to display mode).
Docs.value: if the property should be displayed in edit mode; otherwise, . The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string SimpleDisplayText { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets text to display for the model when the model represents a complex object
Docs.value: Text to display in UI for a complex object. The default value is determined by calling the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.GetSimpleDisplayText%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string TemplateHint { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates what template (data control) should be used in UI for the model.
Docs.value: A value that indicates what template (data control) should be used in UI for the model.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string Watermark { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets watermark text for a text box.
Docs.value: The watermark text.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property contains text to display as a watermark when a property is rendered for editing in a text box. The default value is `null`.
